comment.author: 69022284@N07
comment._content:
I have a shop at this spot, Right byside a pub called Bramerton Woods End which would be behind you in this photo. thats my office :-)
 It  looks slighty different now with hard quay heading from the cow in the picture to as far as the house in the distance but it is still a great spot to moor up a boat and have lunch.
 A lot of the same boats still sail this part of the Yare regularly but for pleasure these days, the one in the picture is heading to Norwich, Norfolk one of Norfolk's larger cities.
  The hill that the large house stands on is what would have been the sea shore long ago before the Dutch came to England and drained the sea from the land, the hill side is rich in fossils and known as the Bramertonian layer in geology.

 Is this picture or a print of it  for sale ?

 Regards
Richard
